message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.OS

This paper deals with the formal specification and verification of information flow security in separation kernels, which is a topic closely related to computer security (cs.CR). The paper also discusses the compliance of separation kernels with the ARINC 653 standard, which is a software engineering issue (cs.SE). The use of Isabelle/HOL for formal verification suggests a focus on programming languages and compilers (cs.PL), while the identification and fixing of security flaws in the ARINC 653 standard involves logic and verification (cs.LO). Finally, the paper also mentions the validation of the security flaws in open-source separation kernels, which falls under the category of operating systems (cs.OS).
